column2: I rented this dress for my Chicago engagement photos.
column3: I paired it with over-the-knee boots to add a little fashion edge to the otherwise sweet and ladylike style.

column5: I loved it too but would have loved it more in  a smaller size.
column6: This dress definitely RUNS LARGE.
column7: Im typically a size 6 in dresses, sometimes an 8 if the brand runs small.
column8: Considering this dress sizing is European, I played it safe and ordered 44 (= US 6) and 46 (= US 8).
column9: The 44 was loose overall, and it was most noticeable in the neck and waist.
column10: I wish I had gotten a size 42 (= US 4) instead, because I likely would have worn it.
column11: I didnt even try on the 46 because it would have been huge.
column12: Im an hourglass/pear shape with a small waist and the dress was pretty loose in the waist and not as fitted/tailored in the bodice and waist as I would have liked.
column13: In some photos, I look thicker in the middle than I am because of the loose fit (you can see the looseness in my second photo).
column14: Previous renters mentioned the dress was too short, but it wasnt for me: It hit mid-thigh, which was perfect with my tall boots.
column15: Ultimately despite the looser fit, I loved the style of the dress and how comfortable it was (the fabric is thick but breathable).
column16: It was exactly what I wanted for my photos.
column18: This dress can be really versatile for a variety of occasions based on how you style it, too.
column19: My order arrived on time and packaged beautifully in a high-quality garment bag.
column20: Both dresses were freshly cleaned and pressed.
column21: My only complaint about the condition of the dress is that fabric on the collar of the dress I wore was starting to separate, so from some angles it looked as if fabric was hanging down.
column22: Thankfully it didnt show in my photos.
column23: Overall: This is an amazing dress that I would definitely recommend -- just order a size down!
